items.title: Who is he? / Who is she?
items.comment: Used to ask about someone's identity. '他' refers to a male, while '她' refers to a female.

items.title: She is my girlfriend.
items.pinyin: tā shì wǒ de nǚ péngyǒu.
items.pronounce: tah shrr waw duh nyoo pung-yoe.

items.title: He is my boyfriend.
items.pinyin: tā shì wǒ de nán péngyǒu.
items.pronounce: tah shrr waw duh nan pung-yoe.

items.title: She is my friend.
items.comment: Used to introduce a female friend. '他是我的朋友' can be used for a male friend.

items.title: She is my Chinese teacher.
items.pinyin: tā shì wǒ de zhōngwén lǎoshī.
items.pronounce: tah shrr waw duh jong-wen laow-shrr.
items.comment: Used to introduce a female Chinese language teacher. Use '他' for a male teacher.
